Blaylock visited the Houston Veteran
Affairs hospital while the VA said it
could not comment on his case without
authorization from his family records
indicate that Blaylock screen positive
for post-traumatic stress disorder and
depression
for anyone who bothered to look
Blaylock's psychological history showed
that even before going to war he had
serious problems when his high-school
girlfriend became pregnant blaylak
married her he joined the Army in 1999
to support his new family and was sent
to Alaska but he and his wife fought
constantly and at one point she accused
him of domestic abuse he later told the
VA he also told a VA interviewer he was
hospitalized for depression in Alaska in
2001 the next year the Army released him
from active duty his discharge paperwork
listed personality disorder as the
reason for his discharge the army placed
Blaylock in the individual Ready Reserve
sarai RR meaning he could still be
called back up for service he was put
into the IRR on a personality disorder
there was no reason for him to be in the
war at all but in late 2005 the time
when the military was in desperate need
of soldiers to combat escalating
violence in Iraq the army called
Blaylock back up when the soldiers went
through an army mental health screening
before they deployed Brien LaGuardia and
two other soldiers warned the army that
Blaylock was too unstable to go into
combat I do remember saying no but you
know you need to check this guy out he
doesn't need to be going to Iraq he's
not in a good state for that and again
when the unit returned from Iraq
laguardia told the army that blaylak was
having problems and we all really felt
honestly that anyone who did take a look

know that it wasn't it wasn't so deeply
hidden that you there talking to Jackie
would realize you know what yeah this
kid's having issues you know maybe it's
maybe it's not the right move it was
like he kind of slipped through the
cracks nobody really paid much attention

indicate he didn't respond to the VA s

the interviewer answered the question is

when they said okay well this is this is

did he feel better that he was going to
